title: Travel Guide from Singapore to Melbourne
description: An overview of my travel from Singapore to Melbourne via the Vaccinated Tavel Lane
contents:
Contents
Pre-Departure
Check In/Transit
Arrival/Settling into Melbourne
Service Victoria App
MyGov Account


Here’s my experience travelling from Singapore to Melbourne via the Vaccinated Travel Lane (VTL) on 02/01/2022. In this post I’ll go through all the procedures the various documents needed pre-departure, during transit and upon arrival at Melbourne.
Do note that quarantine/isolation and testing requirements do change. For the latest update check the Victorian Government website
Pre-Departure
In order to utilize the VTL there are several documents which need to be prepared. It is highly recommended that these documents be printed out.
Vaccination Certificate
Available for download via the Notarise Website.

Australian Travel Declaration
Required to be completed at least 72 hours before departure.

International Passenger Arrival Permit
Arrivals into Victoria require an arrival permit.

Negative PCR Test
Taken within 72 hours of your flight. You can book an appointment at any MOH-Approved Covid 19 Test Providers

Check In/Transit
At check in you will be asked to present physical proof of your vaccine certificate and the negative pre-departure PCR test. Everything else occurs as per usual
Upon boarding the flight you will be given an Australian Travel Declaration Card to declare the items being brought into the country.
Arrival/Settling into Melbourne
After arriving we were required to either take a PCR or RAT (Rapid Antigen Test) test within 24 hours and isolate until we returned a negative result. Another PCR/RAT test is required to be taken between days 5 and 7 after arrival.
Currently RAT kits are sold out in many chemists and pharmacists in Melbourne. I would highly recommend bringing your own kits from Singapore in order to avoid the hassle.
While PCR tests in Melbourne are free the current surge of omicron has resulted in large waves of people lining outside testing sites waiting to get tested. It takes 3-4 hours of waiting in line before even setting foot inside the testing center.

Service Victoria App
Melbourne’s TraceTogether App. The app allows you to check in at stores and acts as quick proof of your vaccination status. It may take between 2-3 working days for the documents to be uploaded onto the server
MyGov Account
